pursue.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time
pursue.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
Students should pursue their own interests, as well as do their school work.
a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
companies that pursue the traditional goal of profits
pursue.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to chase or follow someone or something, in order to catch them, attack them etc
pursue.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Briggs ran across the field with one officer pursuing him.
pursue.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to keep trying to persuade someone to have a relationship with you
pursue.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I was pleased, but somewhat embarrassed, when she pursued me.
pursue.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: You have to be dedicated to pursue a career in medicine.
Always encourage children to pursue their interests.
She was known to be ruthless in pursuing her goals.
David left the company to pursue his political ambitions.
The organization is pursuing a policy of cost cutting.
pursue.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to do something or try to achieve something over a long period of time
pursue.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
Aptech intends to pursue its goal of becoming the market leader.
pursue.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to continue trying to discuss something or deal with something
pursue.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: If the problem is not resolved to your satisfaction, you might be forced to pursue the matter in court.
